description: Ecology focuses on the study of the interrelationships that determine the distribution and abundance of organisms. This core course examines organism-environment interactions and the study of populations, communities and ecosystems. Consideration is given to use of ecological studies in ecosystem management. Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week. Offered each semester. Counts as "ecology" core category. Counts toward environmental studies major (all emphases) and concentration and mathematical biology concentration. Prerequisites: BIO 150.
name: Ecological Principles
notes: Students in Bio 261 must also register for one lab Bio 261 AL, BL, or CL. This course is open to a limited number of first-year students.

revisions.notes: Students in Bio 261 must also register for one lab Bio 261 AL or BL. This course has class-year limits.

This core course examines organism-environment interactions and the study of populations, communities and ecosystems. Consideration is given to use of ecological studies in ecosystem management.
